meanings.definition: To make an opening or incision in something with a sharp tool or object.
meanings.sent1: She carefully cut the paper with scissors.
meanings.sent2: He will cut the cake at the party.
meanings.sent3: The chef cut the vegetables with precision.
meanings.sent4: Her words cut through the silence like a knife.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon's skillful cut saved the patient's life.

meanings.definition: A reduction or decrease in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: The budget cut affected many programs.
meanings.sent2: I need a cut in my workload to relax.
meanings.sent3: The cut in prices attracted more customers.
meanings.sent4: His sudden cut in salary was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The cut in trees changed the landscape drastically.

meanings.definition: To divide or separate something into pieces.
meanings.sent1: She used a knife to cut the cake into slices.
meanings.sent2: The scissors can easily cut through the paper.
meanings.sent3: The magician cut the rope into two pieces.
meanings.sent4: His decision to cut ties with them was final.
meanings.sent5: The saw can cut the wood into smaller pieces.

meanings.definition: A wound or injury caused by a sharp object.
meanings.sent1: He got a small cut while shaving.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful cut on my hand hurt.
meanings.sent4: The cut on his arm was painful but not serious.
meanings.sent5: The paper cut stung more than expected.

meanings.definition: To remove something by using a sharp tool or object.
meanings.sent1: She cut her hair short for a change.
meanings.sent2: He will cut the rope to free the trapped animal.
meanings.sent3: The tailor will cut the fabric to make a dress.
meanings.sent4: The decision to cut ties with them was difficult.
meanings.sent5: The gardener will cut the dead branches for new growth.
